intro: Wahlenbergia schlechteri, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its blue to purple flowers that bloom in spring, typically in coastal regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. Wahlenbergia schlechteri is well adapted to maritime climates and is often used in coastal gardens for its hardiness and ornamental value.
